# Docstring Models Module

This module provides data models for storing structured docstring information in the Griffe documentation system. It defines classes for representing various docstring elements and sections that can be found in Python code documentation.

## Purpose

The module serves as a foundation for parsing and storing structured docstring data, supporting various documentation formats and conventions. It provides a hierarchical structure where:

- **Elements** represent individual documented items (parameters, return values, etc.)
- **Sections** represent organized groups of elements within docstrings

## Core Classes

### Base Element Classes

#### `DocstringElement`

The base class for all docstring elements that don't have names.

```python
element = DocstringElement(
    description="A sample description",
    annotation="str | None"
)
```

**Key attributes:**
- `description`: The element's description text
- `annotation`: Type annotation or other metadata

#### `DocstringNamedElement`

Extends `DocstringElement` for elements that have names (inherits from `DocstringElement`).

```python
named_element = DocstringNamedElement(
    name="param_name",
    description="Parameter description",
    annotation="int",
    value="42"
)
```

**Additional attributes:**
- `name`: The element's name
- `value`: Optional default or example value

### Specialized Element Classes

#### Documentation Elements
- **`DocstringParameter`**: Function/method parameters with `.default` property
- **`DocstringReturn`**: Return value documentation  
- **`DocstringYield`**: Generator yield value documentation
- **`DocstringReceive`**: Async receive value documentation
- **`DocstringRaise`**: Exception documentation
- **`DocstringWarn`**: Warning documentation

#### Code Structure Elements
- **`DocstringAttribute`**: Class/module attributes
- **`DocstringFunction`**: Function documentation with `.signature` property
- **`DocstringClass`**: Class documentation with `.signature` property  
- **`DocstringModule`**: Module documentation

#### Special Elements
- **`DocstringAdmonition`**: Admonitions (notes, warnings, etc.) with `.kind` and `.contents` properties
- **`DocstringDeprecated`**: Deprecation notices with `.version` property

### Section Classes

#### `DocstringSection`

Base class for all docstring sections.

```python
section = DocstringSection(title="Optional Title")
section.value = "Section content"
```

**Key features:**
- `kind`: Section type (from `DocstringSectionKind` enum)
- `title`: Optional section title
- `value`: Section content
- `as_dict()`: Serialization method
- `__bool__()`: Truth testing based on value

#### Specialized Section Classes

| Section Class | Purpose | Value Type |
|---------------|---------|------------|
| `DocstringSectionText` | Plain text content | `str` |
| `DocstringSectionParameters` | Function parameters | `list[DocstringParameter]` |
| `DocstringSectionOtherParameters` | Additional parameters | `list[DocstringParameter]` |
| `DocstringSectionRaises` | Exceptions raised | `list[DocstringRaise]` |
| `DocstringSectionWarns` | Warnings issued | `list[DocstringWarn]` |
| `DocstringSectionReturns` | Return values | `list[DocstringReturn]` |
| `DocstringSectionYields` | Yielded values | `list[DocstringYield]` |
| `DocstringSectionReceives` | Received values | `list[DocstringReceive]` |
| `DocstringSectionAttributes` | Class/module attributes | `list[DocstringAttribute]` |
| `DocstringSectionFunctions` | Functions/methods | `list[DocstringFunction]` |
| `DocstringSectionClasses` | Classes | `list[DocstringClass]` |
| `DocstringSectionModules` | Modules | `list[DocstringModule]` |
| `DocstringSectionExamples` | Code examples | `list[tuple[Literal, str]]` |
| `DocstringSectionDeprecated` | Deprecation info | `DocstringDeprecated` |
| `DocstringSectionAdmonition` | Admonitions | `DocstringAdmonition` |

## Usage Examples

### Creating a Parameter Section

```python
params = [
    DocstringParameter(
        name="x",
        description="The input value",
        annotation="int",
        value="0"
    ),
    DocstringParameter(
        name="y", 
        description="The second input",
        annotation="str"
    )
]

param_section = DocstringSectionParameters(
    value=params,
    title="Parameters"
)
```

### Creating a Deprecation Section

```python
deprecated_section = DocstringSectionDeprecated(
    version="2.0.0",
    text="This function will be removed in version 2.0.0",
    title="Deprecated"
)
```

## Important Notes

- **Serialization**: All classes provide `as_dict()` methods for converting to dictionary format
- **Type Safety**: Extensive use of type hints and `TYPE_CHECKING` imports
- **Inheritance**: Clear hierarchy with base classes providing common functionality
- **Flexibility**: Support for both named and unnamed elements, optional annotations and values

## Dependencies

- `_griffe.enumerations.DocstringSectionKind`: Enum defining section types
- `_griffe.expressions.Expr`: Expression type for annotations
- Built-in `typing` module for type hints

This module forms the core data structure for docstring parsing and manipulation in the Griffe documentation system.
